newsitem.title: USA: Japan seeks U.S., Canadian and Australian wheat.
newsitem.headline: Japan seeks U.S., Canadian and Australian wheat.

text.p: The Japanese Food Agency will seek on Wednesday night a total of 60,000 tonnes U.S. wheat, 40,000 tonnes Canadian wheat and 40,000 tonnes Australian wheat, several U.S.-based Japanese export firms said.

The deal includes 20,000 tonnes of U.S. western white wheat, 20,000 tonnes of U.S. hard red winter wheat, 13 percent protein content, and a combination cargo of 11,000 tonnes U.S. northern spring/dark northern spring and 9,000 tonne HRW wheat, minimum 11.7 percent protein content.
It is also tendering for 16,000 tonnes of U.S. or Canadian origin feed barley and 60,000 tonnes Australian feed barley.
The shipping period for all commodities is November 11-December 10.
